content: acts of service cowl i designed this cowl to use up the many 4ply fingering weight scraps we all seem to have in our stashes you can use as many or as few colours as you like i ve knit this cowl many times now and have not found a combination that doesn t look nice it also looks quite good turned inside out so that the purl fabric shows there are 6 sizes to this cowl from toddler to teen the sizes and measurements correspond to the sizing chart for australian knitting for war affected children a wonderful group of crafters aiming to provide warm handmade clothing for children in idp camps it s these children i designed this cowl for so if you use my pattern and enjoy it please consider knitting and donating a cowl to this wonderful cause also note on colour changes i like to knit this cowl with lots of little bits and pieces of 4ply yarn as they are all different lengths i simply add in a new colour as each colour i am using runs out as the joins will generally be in different spots for each of your strands of wool i tend to weave the ends in as i go by simply tying a knot and then knitting holding the working yarn and the ends together for a few stitches it makes it extra thick and warm it s virtually unnoticeable and you are only left with 2 ends to sew in once finished even though you may have used 20 colours materials needed 5mm dpns or 5mm circular needles 4ply wool at least 3 different colours or strands a stitch marker sizes are 1-2 yrs 3-4yrs 5-8yrs 10-12yrs 13-14yrs 15yrs+ holding three strands of 4ply together cast on 80 84 88 92 96 100 stitches i like the german twisted cast on for stretchability knit in 2x2 rib for 1 5 inches 4cm knit a further 4 5 6 6 7 7 inches 11 13 15 15 17 17 cms in stockinette knit in 2x2 rib for a further 1 5 inches 4cm and bind off in pattern i like to use the elastic bind off method it does flare a little but it s so super stretchy it s good for sitting at the bottom of the neck which is thicker than the top approximate dimensions for the finished cowls are 1-2yrs circumference 18inches 45cm height 7 inches 18 cms 3-4yrs circumference 19 inches 48cms height 8 inches 20cms 5-8yrs circumference 20 inches 50cms height 9 inches 22cms 9-12yrs circumference 21 inches 53cms height 9 inches 22cms 13-14yrs circumference 22 inches 56cms height 10 inches 25cms 15+yrs circumference 23 inches 58cms height 10 inches 25cms depending on which yarns you use the circumference can be an inch or 2 bigger this is fine and the cowls still fit quite well
